<link>http://slashdot.org/</link> </image> <item rdf:about="http://politics.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/2057204/new-jersey-removes-legal-impediment-to-direct-tesla-sales?utm_source=rss1.0mainlinkanon&utm_medium=feed"> <title>New Jersey Removes Legal Impediment To Direct Tesla Sales</title> <link>http://rss.slashdot.org/~r/Slashdot/slashdot/~3/8t4Hb4aMz70/new-jersey-removes-legal-impediment-to-direct-tesla-sales</link> <description>As reported by The Verge, the rule-makers of New Jersey have relented, and will now allow a slightly freer market for cars.  Almost exactly one year after it was banned from selling its cars directly in New Jersey, Tesla will be back in business in the Garden State. Governor Chris Christie signed into law a bill this afternoon that reversed last year's ban. The new legislation comes with some limits. Tesla can only open a total of four direct sale dealerships and has to operate at least one service center. But it's a major win following a heated war of words that saw Tesla CEO Elon Musk compare local dealers to a mafia protection racket subverting the democratic process.<p><div class="share_submission" style="position:relative;"> <a class="slashpop" href="http://twitter.com/home?status=New+Jersey+Removes+Legal+Impediment+To+Direct+Tesla+Sales%3A+http%3A%2F%2Fbit.ly%2F1DBfwbB"><img src="http://a.fsdn.com/sd/twitter_icon_large.png"></a> <a class="slashpop" href="http://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=http%3A%2F%2Fpolitics.slashdot.org%2Fstory%2F15%2F03%2F18%2F2057204%2Fnew-jersey-removes-legal-impediment-to-direct-tesla-sales%3Futm_source%3Dslashdot%26utm_medium%3Dfacebook"><img src="http://a.fsdn.com/sd/facebook_icon_large.png"></a>  <a class="nobg" href="http://plus.google.com/share?url=http://politics.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/2057204/new-jersey-removes-legal-impediment-to-direct-tesla-sales?utm_source=slashdot&amp;utm_medium=googleplus" onclick="javascript:window.open(this.href,'', 'menubar=no,toolbar=no,resizable=yes,scrollbars=yes,height=600,width=600');return false;"><img src="http://www.gstatic.com/images/icons/gplus-16.png" alt="Share on Google+"/></a>                                                                                                                                                                                  </div></p><p><a href="http://politics.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/2057204/new-jersey-removes-legal-impediment-to-direct-tesla-sales?utm_source=rss1.0moreanon&amp;utm_medium=feed">Read more of this story</a> at Slashdot.</p><iframe src="http://slashdot.org/slashdot-it.pl?op=discuss&amp;id=7121917&amp;smallembed=1" style="height: 300px; width: 100%; border: none;"></iframe><img src="//feeds.feedburner.com/~r/Slashdot/slashdot/~4/8t4Hb4aMz70" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description> <dc:creator>timothy</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-03-18T21:17:00+00:00</dc:date> <dc:subject>business</dc:subject> <slash:department>beating-back-mob-rule</slash:department> <slash:section>politics</slash:section> <slash:comments>6</slash:comments> <slash:hit_parade>6,6,1,1,1,0,0</slash:hit_parade> <feedburner:origLink>http://politics.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/2057204/new-jersey-removes-legal-impediment-to-direct-tesla-sales?utm_source=rss1.0mainlinkanon&utm_medium=feed</feedburner:origLink></item> <item rdf:about="http://yro.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/2039225/twitter-adds-tool-to-report-tweets-to-the-police?utm_source=rss1.0mainlinkanon&utm_medium=feed"> <title>Twitter Adds Tool To Report Tweets To the Police</title> <link>http://rss.slashdot.org/~r/Slashdot/slashdot/~3/OoIiuULIGaw/twitter-adds-tool-to-report-tweets-to-the-police</link> <description>itwbennett writes Twitter is ramping up its efforts to combat harassment with a tool to help users report abusive content to law enforcement. The reports would include the flagged tweet and its URL, the time at which it was sent, the user name and account URL of the person who posted it, as well as a link to Twitter's guidelines on how authorities can request non-public user account information from Twitter. It is left up to the user to forward the report to law enforcement and left up to law enforcement to request the user information from Twitter.<p><div class="share_submission" style="position:relative;"> <a class="slashpop" href="http://twitter.com/home?status=Twitter+Adds+Tool+To+Report+Tweets+To+the+Police%3A+http%3A%2F%2Fbit.ly%2F1GYRdSB"><img src="http://a.fsdn.com/sd/twitter_icon_large.png"></a> <a class="slashpop" href="http://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=http%3A%2F%2Fyro.slashdot.org%2Fstory%2F15%2F03%2F18%2F2039225%2Ftwitter-adds-tool-to-report-tweets-to-the-police%3Futm_source%3Dslashdot%26utm_medium%3Dfacebook"><img src="http://a.fsdn.com/sd/facebook_icon_large.png"></a>  <a class="nobg" href="http://plus.google.com/share?url=http://yro.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/2039225/twitter-adds-tool-to-report-tweets-to-the-police?utm_source=slashdot&amp;utm_medium=googleplus" onclick="javascript:window.open(this.href,'', 'menubar=no,toolbar=no,resizable=yes,scrollbars=yes,height=600,width=600');return false;"><img src="http://www.gstatic.com/images/icons/gplus-16.png" alt="Share on Google+"/></a>                                                                                                                                                                                  </div></p><p><a href="http://yro.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/2039225/twitter-adds-tool-to-report-tweets-to-the-police?utm_source=rss1.0moreanon&amp;utm_medium=feed">Read more of this story</a> at Slashdot.</p><iframe src="http://slashdot.org/slashdot-it.pl?op=discuss&amp;id=7121849&amp;smallembed=1" style="height: 300px; width: 100%; border: none;"></iframe><img src="//feeds.feedburner.com/~r/Slashdot/slashdot/~4/OoIiuULIGaw" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description> <dc:creator>timothy</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-03-18T20:58:00+00:00</dc:date> <dc:subject>communications</dc:subject> <slash:department>but-first-this-detour-to-fort-meade</slash:department> <slash:section>yro</slash:section> <slash:comments>12</slash:comments> <slash:hit_parade>12,11,4,4,1,0,0</slash:hit_parade> <feedburner:origLink>http://yro.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/2039225/twitter-adds-tool-to-report-tweets-to-the-police?utm_source=rss1.0mainlinkanon&utm_medium=feed</feedburner:origLink></item> <item rdf:about="http://yro.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1928213/stanford-study-credits-lack-of-non-competes-for-silicon-valleys-success?utm_source=rss1.0mainlinkanon&utm_medium=feed"> <title>Stanford Study Credits Lack of Non-Competes For Silicon Valley's Success</title> <link>http://rss.slashdot.org/~r/Slashdot/slashdot/~3/T-apnj08a5k/stanford-study-credits-lack-of-non-competes-for-silicon-valleys-success</link> <description>HughPickens.com writes Natalie Kitroeff writes at Bloomberg that a new study says the secret to Silicon Valley's triumph as the global capital of innovation may lie in a quirk of California's employment law that prohibits the legal enforcement of non-compete clauses. Unlike most states, California prohibits enforcement of non-compete clauses that force people who leave jobs to wait for a predetermined period before taking positions at rival companies. That puts California in the ideal position to rob other regions of their most prized inventors, "Policymakers who sanction the use of non-competes could be inadvertently creating regional disadvantage as far as retention of knowledge workers is concerned," wrote the authors of the study "Regional disadvantage? Employee non-compete agreements and brain drain" (PDF). "Regions that choose to enforce employee non-compete agreements may therefore be subjecting  themselves to a domestic brain drain not unlike that described in the literature on international emigration out of less developed countries."   The study, which looked at the behavior of people who had registered at least two patents from 1975 to 2005, focused on Michigan, which in 1985 reversed its longstanding prohibition of non-compete agreements. The authors found that after Michigan changed the rules, the rate of emigration among inventors was twice as a high as it was in states where non-competes remained illegal. Even worse for Michigan, its most talented inventors were also the most likely to flee. "Firms are going to be willing to relocate someone who is really good, as opposed to someone who is average," says Lee Fleming. For the inventors, it makes sense to take a risk on a place such as California, where they have more freedom. "If the job they relocate for doesn't work out, then they can walk across the street because there are no non-competes."<p><div class="share_submission" style="position:relative;"> <a class="slashpop" href="http://twitter.com/home?status=Stanford+Study+Credits+Lack+of+Non-Competes+For+Silicon+Valley's+Success%3A+http%3A%2F%2Fbit.ly%2F1DB673K"><img src="http://a.fsdn.com/sd/twitter_icon_large.png"></a> <a class="slashpop" href="http://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=http%3A%2F%2Fyro.slashdot.org%2Fstory%2F15%2F03%2F18%2F1928213%2Fstanford-study-credits-lack-of-non-competes-for-silicon-valleys-success%3Futm_source%3Dslashdot%26utm_medium%3Dfacebook"><img src="http://a.fsdn.com/sd/facebook_icon_large.png"></a>  <a class="nobg" href="http://plus.google.com/share?url=http://yro.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1928213/stanford-study-credits-lack-of-non-competes-for-silicon-valleys-success?utm_source=slashdot&amp;utm_medium=googleplus" onclick="javascript:window.open(this.href,'', 'menubar=no,toolbar=no,resizable=yes,scrollbars=yes,height=600,width=600');return false;"><img src="http://www.gstatic.com/images/icons/gplus-16.png" alt="Share on Google+"/></a>                                                                                                                                                                                  </div></p><p><a href="http://yro.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1928213/stanford-study-credits-lack-of-non-competes-for-silicon-valleys-success?utm_source=rss1.0moreanon&amp;utm_medium=feed">Read more of this story</a> at Slashdot.</p><iframe src="http://slashdot.org/slashdot-it.pl?op=discuss&amp;id=7121645&amp;smallembed=1" style="height: 300px; width: 100%; border: none;"></iframe><img src="//feeds.feedburner.com/~r/Slashdot/slashdot/~4/T-apnj08a5k" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description> <dc:creator>timothy</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-03-18T20:34:00+00:00</dc:date> <dc:subject>business</dc:subject> <slash:department>santa-clara-clause</slash:department> <slash:section>yro</slash:section> <slash:comments>27</slash:comments> <slash:hit_parade>27,27,20,19,3,2,1</slash:hit_parade> <feedburner:origLink>http://yro.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1928213/stanford-study-credits-lack-of-non-competes-for-silicon-valleys-success?utm_source=rss1.0mainlinkanon&utm_medium=feed</feedburner:origLink></item> <item rdf:about="http://games.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1717219/project-an-interactive-game-on-your-floor-or-wall-video?utm_source=rss1.0mainlinkanon&utm_medium=feed"> <title>Project an Interactive Game on Your Floor or Wall (Video)</title> <link>http://rss.slashdot.org/~r/Slashdot/slashdot/~3/Xb39TPS3vK0/project-an-interactive-game-on-your-floor-or-wall-video</link> <description>Lumo is an interactive projector. You can use it to bore people with PowerPoint slides or you can use it as a game machine. It has a built-in (low res) camera that can detect a kick (as shown at the beginning of the video) and make a (virtual) ball move as a result of that action. 'But,' you ask, 'do they have an Indiegogo campaign?' Not yet. It launches on March 23.   The Lumo projector was originally designed for commercial use at children's museums and as a trade show attention-getter -- at $10,000 a pop. The consumer version is expected to cost less than $500, according to Lumo CEO (and Slashdot interviewee) Meghan Athavale. And while she doesn't talk much about it in the interview, if you already have a computer, a projector, and a Kinect or webcam, you can buy the a stripped-down version of the company's 'interactive-floor-wall projection' software for $39, plus games or customizable game templates.<p><div class="share_submission" style="position:relative;"> <a class="slashpop" href="http://twitter.com/home?status=Project+an+Interactive+Game+on+Your+Floor+or+Wall+(Video)%3A+http%3A%2F%2Fbit.ly%2F1ErCdKr"><img src="http://a.fsdn.com/sd/twitter_icon_large.png"></a> <a class="slashpop" href="http://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=http%3A%2F%2Fgames.slashdot.org%2Fstory%2F15%2F03%2F18%2F1717219%2Fproject-an-interactive-game-on-your-floor-or-wall-video%3Futm_source%3Dslashdot%26utm_medium%3Dfacebook"><img src="http://a.fsdn.com/sd/facebook_icon_large.png"></a>  <a class="nobg" href="http://plus.google.com/share?url=http://games.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1717219/project-an-interactive-game-on-your-floor-or-wall-video?utm_source=slashdot&amp;utm_medium=googleplus" onclick="javascript:window.open(this.href,'', 'menubar=no,toolbar=no,resizable=yes,scrollbars=yes,height=600,width=600');return false;"><img src="http://www.gstatic.com/images/icons/gplus-16.png" alt="Share on Google+"/></a>                                                                                                                                                                                  </div></p><p><a href="http://games.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1717219/project-an-interactive-game-on-your-floor-or-wall-video?utm_source=rss1.0moreanon&amp;utm_medium=feed">Read more of this story</a> at Slashdot.</p><iframe src="http://slashdot.org/slashdot-it.pl?op=discuss&amp;id=7121063&amp;smallembed=1" style="height: 300px; width: 100%; border: none;"></iframe><img src="//feeds.feedburner.com/~r/Slashdot/slashdot/~4/Xb39TPS3vK0" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description> <dc:creator>Roblimo</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-03-18T19:54:00+00:00</dc:date> <dc:subject>games</dc:subject> <slash:department>bounce-it-on-the-floor-or-bounce-it-on-the-wall</slash:department> <slash:section>games</slash:section> <slash:comments>24</slash:comments> <slash:hit_parade>24,24,14,13,2,1,0</slash:hit_parade> <feedburner:origLink>http://games.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1717219/project-an-interactive-game-on-your-floor-or-wall-video?utm_source=rss1.0mainlinkanon&utm_medium=feed</feedburner:origLink></item> <item rdf:about="http://ask.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1224205/ask-slashdot-choosing-a-laptop-to-support-physics-research?utm_source=rss1.0mainlinkanon&utm_medium=feed"> <title>Ask Slashdot:  Choosing a Laptop To Support Physics Research?</title> <link>http://rss.slashdot.org/~r/Slashdot/slashdot/~3/ZbjyU37ZVyo/ask-slashdot-choosing-a-laptop-to-support-physics-research</link> <description>An anonymous reader writes My daughter is in her third year of college as a physics major. She has an internship in Europe this summer, will graduate next year, and continue with graduate physics studies. Her area of research interest is in gravitational waves and particle physics. She currently has a laptop running Win7 and wants to buy a new laptop. She would like to use Linux on it, and plans to use it for C++ programming, data analysis and simulations (along with the usual email, surfing, music, pictures, etc). For all of the physics-savvy Slashdotters out there: what should she get? PC? Mac? What do you recommend for running Linux? For a C++ development environment? What laptop do you use and how is it configured to support your physics-related activities?<p><div class="share_submission" style="position:relative;"> <a class="slashpop" href="http://twitter.com/home?status=Ask+Slashdot%3A++Choosing+a+Laptop+To+Support+Physics+Research%3F%3A+http%3A%2F%2Fbit.ly%2F1H2myqW"><img src="http://a.fsdn.com/sd/twitter_icon_large.png"></a> <a class="slashpop" href="http://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=http%3A%2F%2Fask.slashdot.org%2Fstory%2F15%2F03%2F18%2F1224205%2Fask-slashdot-choosing-a-laptop-to-support-physics-research%3Futm_source%3Dslashdot%26utm_medium%3Dfacebook"><img src="http://a.fsdn.com/sd/facebook_icon_large.png"></a>  <a class="nobg" href="http://plus.google.com/share?url=http://ask.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1224205/ask-slashdot-choosing-a-laptop-to-support-physics-research?utm_source=slashdot&amp;utm_medium=googleplus" onclick="javascript:window.open(this.href,'', 'menubar=no,toolbar=no,resizable=yes,scrollbars=yes,height=600,width=600');return false;"><img src="http://www.gstatic.com/images/icons/gplus-16.png" alt="Share on Google+"/></a>                                                                                                                                                                                  </div></p><p><a href="http://ask.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1224205/ask-slashdot-choosing-a-laptop-to-support-physics-research?utm_source=rss1.0moreanon&amp;utm_medium=feed">Read more of this story</a> at Slashdot.</p><iframe src="http://slashdot.org/slashdot-it.pl?op=discuss&amp;id=7119713&amp;smallembed=1" style="height: 300px; width: 100%; border: none;"></iframe><img src="//feeds.feedburner.com/~r/Slashdot/slashdot/~4/ZbjyU37ZVyo" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description> <dc:creator>timothy</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-03-18T19:12:00+00:00</dc:date> <dc:subject>portables</dc:subject> <slash:department>budget-for-replacement-too</slash:department> <slash:section>askslashdot</slash:section> <slash:comments>177</slash:comments> <slash:hit_parade>177,174,106,85,12,5,4</slash:hit_parade> <feedburner:origLink>http://ask.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1224205/ask-slashdot-choosing-a-laptop-to-support-physics-research?utm_source=rss1.0mainlinkanon&utm_medium=feed</feedburner:origLink></item> <item rdf:about="http://tech.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1733245/full-duplex-radio-integrated-circuit-could-double-radio-frequency-data-capacity?utm_source=rss1.0mainlinkanon&utm_medium=feed"> <title>Full-Duplex Radio Integrated Circuit Could Double Radio Frequency Data Capacity</title> <link>http://rss.slashdot.org/~r/Slashdot/slashdot/~3/oShTu7cKV_s/full-duplex-radio-integrated-circuit-could-double-radio-frequency-data-capacity</link> <description>Zothecula writes Full-duplex radio communication usually involves transmitters and receivers operating at different frequencies. Simultaneous transmission and reception on the same frequency is the Holy Grail for researchers, but has proved difficult to achieve. Those that have been built have proven complex and bulky, but to be commercially useful in the ever-shrinking world of communications technology, miniaturization is key. To this end, engineers at Columbia University (CU) claim to have created a world-first, full-duplex radio transceiver, all on one miniature integrated circuit.<p><div class="share_submission" style="position:relative;"> <a class="slashpop" href="http://twitter.com/home?status=Full-Duplex+Radio+Integrated+Circuit+Could+Double+Radio+Frequency+Data+Capacity%3A+http%3A%2F%2Fbit.ly%2F1CwaWvm"><img src="http://a.fsdn.com/sd/twitter_icon_large.png"></a> <a class="slashpop" href="http://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=http%3A%2F%2Ftech.slashdot.org%2Fstory%2F15%2F03%2F18%2F1733245%2Ffull-duplex-radio-integrated-circuit-could-double-radio-frequency-data-capacity%3Futm_source%3Dslashdot%26utm_medium%3Dfacebook"><img src="http://a.fsdn.com/sd/facebook_icon_large.png"></a>  <a class="nobg" href="http://plus.google.com/share?url=http://tech.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1733245/full-duplex-radio-integrated-circuit-could-double-radio-frequency-data-capacity?utm_source=slashdot&amp;utm_medium=googleplus" onclick="javascript:window.open(this.href,'', 'menubar=no,toolbar=no,resizable=yes,scrollbars=yes,height=600,width=600');return false;"><img src="http://www.gstatic.com/images/icons/gplus-16.png" alt="Share on Google+"/></a>                                                                                                                                                                                  </div></p><p><a href="http://tech.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1733245/full-duplex-radio-integrated-circuit-could-double-radio-frequency-data-capacity?utm_source=rss1.0moreanon&amp;utm_medium=feed">Read more of this story</a> at Slashdot.</p><iframe src="http://slashdot.org/slashdot-it.pl?op=discuss&amp;id=7121165&amp;smallembed=1" style="height: 300px; width: 100%; border: none;"></iframe><img src="//feeds.feedburner.com/~r/Slashdot/slashdot/~4/oShTu7cKV_s" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description> <dc:creator>timothy</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-03-18T18:30:00+00:00</dc:date> <dc:subject>communications</dc:subject> <slash:department>if-you-use-two-of-them-it's-even-better</slash:department> <slash:section>technology</slash:section> <slash:comments>29</slash:comments> <slash:hit_parade>29,26,17,15,8,3,3</slash:hit_parade> <feedburner:origLink>http://tech.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1733245/full-duplex-radio-integrated-circuit-could-double-radio-frequency-data-capacity?utm_source=rss1.0mainlinkanon&utm_medium=feed</feedburner:origLink></item> <item rdf:about="http://yro.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1735242/france-will-block-web-sites-that-promote-terrorism?utm_source=rss1.0mainlinkanon&utm_medium=feed"> <title>France Will Block Web Sites That Promote Terrorism</title> <link>http://rss.slashdot.org/~r/Slashdot/slashdot/~3/BBOpKEc8IL4/france-will-block-web-sites-that-promote-terrorism</link> <description>An anonymous reader writes In the first use of government powers enacted after the Charlie Hebdo attacks, the French Interior Ministry on Monday ordered five websites blocked on the grounds that they promote or advocate terrorism. The action raises questions about how governments might counter groups such as the self-declared Islamic State on digital platforms.<p><div class="share_submission" style="position:relative;"> <a class="slashpop" href="http://twitter.com/home?status=France+Will+Block+Web+Sites+That+Promote+Terrorism%3A+http%3A%2F%2Fbit.ly%2F1BQ8zA9"><img src="http://a.fsdn.com/sd/twitter_icon_large.png"></a> <a class="slashpop" href="http://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=http%3A%2F%2Fyro.slashdot.org%2Fstory%2F15%2F03%2F18%2F1735242%2Ffrance-will-block-web-sites-that-promote-terrorism%3Futm_source%3Dslashdot%26utm_medium%3Dfacebook"><img src="http://a.fsdn.com/sd/facebook_icon_large.png"></a>  <a class="nobg" href="http://plus.google.com/share?url=http://yro.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1735242/france-will-block-web-sites-that-promote-terrorism?utm_source=slashdot&amp;utm_medium=googleplus" onclick="javascript:window.open(this.href,'', 'menubar=no,toolbar=no,resizable=yes,scrollbars=yes,height=600,width=600');return false;"><img src="http://www.gstatic.com/images/icons/gplus-16.png" alt="Share on Google+"/></a>                                                                                                                                                                                  </div></p><p><a href="http://yro.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1735242/france-will-block-web-sites-that-promote-terrorism?utm_source=rss1.0moreanon&amp;utm_medium=feed">Read more of this story</a> at Slashdot.</p><iframe src="http://slashdot.org/slashdot-it.pl?op=discuss&amp;id=7121181&amp;smallembed=1" style="height: 300px; width: 100%; border: none;"></iframe><img src="//feeds.feedburner.com/~r/Slashdot/slashdot/~4/BBOpKEc8IL4" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description> <dc:creator>timothy</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-03-18T17:48:00+00:00</dc:date> <dc:subject>censorship</dc:subject> <slash:department>good-luck-with-all-that</slash:department> <slash:section>yro</slash:section> <slash:comments>147</slash:comments> <slash:hit_parade>147,145,109,81,25,14,6</slash:hit_parade> <feedburner:origLink>http://yro.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1735242/france-will-block-web-sites-that-promote-terrorism?utm_source=rss1.0mainlinkanon&utm_medium=feed</feedburner:origLink></item> <item rdf:about="http://tech.slashdot.org/story/15/03/16/1512248/ask-gms-exec-chief-engineer-for-electric-vehicles-pam-fletcher-a-question?utm_source=rss1.0mainlinkanon&utm_medium=feed"> <title>Ask GM's Exec. Chief Engineer For Electric Vehicles Pam Fletcher a Question</title> <link>http://rss.slashdot.org/~r/Slashdot/slashdot/~3/ffWa3QNN9G4/ask-gms-exec-chief-engineer-for-electric-vehicles-pam-fletcher-a-question</link> <description>Pam Fletcher was propulsion system chief engineer on the first Chevrolet Volt plug-in hybrid and is now executive chief engineer for electrified vehicles at GM. A racing enthusiast, Pam developed racing engines for GM , McLaren, and NASCAR's Dale Earnhardt Sr.. Her current role has her running a multi-national department overseeing electrified vehicles company-wide. Fletcher has agreed to take a moment out of her busy day to answer any questions you might have. As usual, ask as many as you'd like, but please, one per post.<p><div class="share_submission" style="position:relative;"> <a class="slashpop" href="http://twitter.com/home?status=Ask+GM's+Exec.+Chief+Engineer+For+Electric+Vehicles+Pam+Fletcher+a+Question%3A+http%3A%2F%2Fbit.ly%2F19zL5WE"><img src="http://a.fsdn.com/sd/twitter_icon_large.png"></a> <a class="slashpop" href="http://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=http%3A%2F%2Ftech.slashdot.org%2Fstory%2F15%2F03%2F16%2F1512248%2Fask-gms-exec-chief-engineer-for-electric-vehicles-pam-fletcher-a-question%3Futm_source%3Dslashdot%26utm_medium%3Dfacebook"><img src="http://a.fsdn.com/sd/facebook_icon_large.png"></a>  <a class="nobg" href="http://plus.google.com/share?url=http://tech.slashdot.org/story/15/03/16/1512248/ask-gms-exec-chief-engineer-for-electric-vehicles-pam-fletcher-a-question?utm_source=slashdot&amp;utm_medium=googleplus" onclick="javascript:window.open(this.href,'', 'menubar=no,toolbar=no,resizable=yes,scrollbars=yes,height=600,width=600');return false;"><img src="http://www.gstatic.com/images/icons/gplus-16.png" alt="Share on Google+"/></a>                                                                                                                                                                                  </div></p><p><a href="http://tech.slashdot.org/story/15/03/16/1512248/ask-gms-exec-chief-engineer-for-electric-vehicles-pam-fletcher-a-question?utm_source=rss1.0moreanon&amp;utm_medium=feed">Read more of this story</a> at Slashdot.</p><iframe src="http://slashdot.org/slashdot-it.pl?op=discuss&amp;id=7107967&amp;smallembed=1" style="height: 300px; width: 100%; border: none;"></iframe><img src="//feeds.feedburner.com/~r/Slashdot/slashdot/~4/ffWa3QNN9G4" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description> <dc:creator>samzenpus</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-03-18T17:07:00+00:00</dc:date> <dc:subject>power</dc:subject> <slash:department>go-ahead-and-ask</slash:department> <slash:section>technology</slash:section> <slash:comments>155</slash:comments> <slash:hit_parade>155,149,108,81,17,3,1</slash:hit_parade> <feedburner:origLink>http://tech.slashdot.org/story/15/03/16/1512248/ask-gms-exec-chief-engineer-for-electric-vehicles-pam-fletcher-a-question?utm_source=rss1.0mainlinkanon&utm_medium=feed</feedburner:origLink></item> <item rdf:about="http://science.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1619256/gates-large-epidemics-need-a-more-agile-response?utm_source=rss1.0mainlinkanon&utm_medium=feed"> <title>Gates: Large Epidemics Need a More Agile Response</title> <link>http://rss.slashdot.org/~r/Slashdot/slashdot/~3/-sNcTPtHOUU/gates-large-epidemics-need-a-more-agile-response</link> <description>jones_supa writes: Writing in the NY Times about the recent Ebola crisis, Bill Gates says this disease has made the world realize we are not properly prepared to deal with a global epidemic. Even if we signed up lots of experts right away, few organizations are capable of moving thousands of people, some of them infected, to different locations on the globe, with a week's notice. Data is another crucial problem. During the Ebola epidemic, the database that tracks cases has not always been accurate. This is partly because the situation is chaotic, but also because much of the case reporting has been done first on paper. There's also our failure to invest in effective medical tools like tests, drugs and vaccines. On average, it has taken an estimated one to three days for test results to come back &mdash; an eternity when you need to quarantine people. Drugs that might help stop Ebola were not tested in patients until after the epidemic had peaked, partly because the world has no clear process for expediting drug approvals. Compare all of this to the preparation that nations put into defense, which has high-quality mobile units ready to be deployed quickly.<p><div class="share_submission" style="position:relative;"> <a class="slashpop" href="http://twitter.com/home?status=Gates%3A+Large+Epidemics+Need+a+More+Agile+Response%3A+http%3A%2F%2Fbit.ly%2F191W3TF"><img src="http://a.fsdn.com/sd/twitter_icon_large.png"></a> <a class="slashpop" href="http://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=http%3A%2F%2Fscience.slashdot.org%2Fstory%2F15%2F03%2F18%2F1619256%2Fgates-large-epidemics-need-a-more-agile-response%3Futm_source%3Dslashdot%26utm_medium%3Dfacebook"><img src="http://a.fsdn.com/sd/facebook_icon_large.png"></a>  <a class="nobg" href="http://plus.google.com/share?url=http://science.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1619256/gates-large-epidemics-need-a-more-agile-response?utm_source=slashdot&amp;utm_medium=googleplus" onclick="javascript:window.open(this.href,'', 'menubar=no,toolbar=no,resizable=yes,scrollbars=yes,height=600,width=600');return false;"><img src="http://www.gstatic.com/images/icons/gplus-16.png" alt="Share on Google+"/></a>                                                                                                                                                                                  </div></p><p><a href="http://science.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1619256/gates-large-epidemics-need-a-more-agile-response?utm_source=rss1.0moreanon&amp;utm_medium=feed">Read more of this story</a> at Slashdot.</p><iframe src="http://slashdot.org/slashdot-it.pl?op=discuss&amp;id=7120777&amp;smallembed=1" style="height: 300px; width: 100%; border: none;"></iframe><img src="//feeds.feedburner.com/~r/Slashdot/slashdot/~4/-sNcTPtHOUU" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description> <dc:creator>Soulskill</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-03-18T16:25:00+00:00</dc:date> <dc:subject>medicine</dc:subject> <slash:department>looking-to-hire-The-Flash</slash:department> <slash:section>science</slash:section> <slash:comments>103</slash:comments> <slash:hit_parade>103,101,68,57,23,10,4</slash:hit_parade> <feedburner:origLink>http://science.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1619256/gates-large-epidemics-need-a-more-agile-response?utm_source=rss1.0mainlinkanon&utm_medium=feed</feedburner:origLink></item> <item rdf:about="http://yro.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1451208/uk-chancellor-confirms-introduction-of-google-tax?utm_source=rss1.0mainlinkanon&utm_medium=feed"> <title>UK Chancellor Confirms Introduction of 'Google Tax'</title> <link>http://rss.slashdot.org/~r/Slashdot/slashdot/~3/H8HMHumV6Qc/uk-chancellor-confirms-introduction-of-google-tax</link> <description>mrspoonsi sends this report from the BBC: Companies that move their profits overseas to avoid tax will be subject to a "diverted profits tax" from April, the chancellor has said. In his final Budget before the election, George Osborne said firms that aid tax evasion will also face new penalties and criminal prosecutions. The so-called "Google Tax" is designed to discourage large companies diverting profits out of the the UK to avoid tax. "Let the message go out: this country's tolerance for those who will not pay their fair share of taxes has come to an end," Mr. Osborne said. In 2012 it emerged that internet giant Google avoided tax on &pound;10bn UK revenue in 2011 by doubling the amount of money put into a shell company in Bermuda. Doing so helped it avoid &pound;1bn in corporation tax. Under the new tax regime, companies with an annual turnover of &pound;10m will have to tell HM Revenue &amp; Customs (HMRC) if they think their company structure could make them liable for diverted profit tax. Once HMRC has assessed the structures, and decided how much profit has been artificially diverted from the UK, multinationals will have only 30 days to object to the 25% tax.<p><div class="share_submission" style="position:relative;"> <a class="slashpop" href="http://twitter.com/home?status=UK+Chancellor+Confirms+Introduction+of+'Google+Tax'%3A+http%3A%2F%2Fbit.ly%2F1H1RFD4"><img src="http://a.fsdn.com/sd/twitter_icon_large.png"></a> <a class="slashpop" href="http://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=http%3A%2F%2Fyro.slashdot.org%2Fstory%2F15%2F03%2F18%2F1451208%2Fuk-chancellor-confirms-introduction-of-google-tax%3Futm_source%3Dslashdot%26utm_medium%3Dfacebook"><img src="http://a.fsdn.com/sd/facebook_icon_large.png"></a>  <a class="nobg" href="http://plus.google.com/share?url=http://yro.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1451208/uk-chancellor-confirms-introduction-of-google-tax?utm_source=slashdot&amp;utm_medium=googleplus" onclick="javascript:window.open(this.href,'', 'menubar=no,toolbar=no,resizable=yes,scrollbars=yes,height=600,width=600');return false;"><img src="http://www.gstatic.com/images/icons/gplus-16.png" alt="Share on Google+"/></a>                                                                                                                                                                                  </div></p><p><a href="http://yro.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1451208/uk-chancellor-confirms-introduction-of-google-tax?utm_source=rss1.0moreanon&amp;utm_medium=feed">Read more of this story</a> at Slashdot.</p><iframe src="http://slashdot.org/slashdot-it.pl?op=discuss&amp;id=7120305&amp;smallembed=1" style="height: 300px; width: 100%; border: none;"></iframe><img src="//feeds.feedburner.com/~r/Slashdot/slashdot/~4/H8HMHumV6Qc" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description> <dc:creator>Soulskill</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-03-18T15:45:00+00:00</dc:date> <dc:subject>business</dc:subject> <slash:department>corporations-behaving-badly</slash:department> <slash:section>yro</slash:section> <slash:comments>239</slash:comments> <slash:hit_parade>239,236,159,148,24,14,9</slash:hit_parade> <feedburner:origLink>http://yro.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1451208/uk-chancellor-confirms-introduction-of-google-tax?utm_source=rss1.0mainlinkanon&utm_medium=feed</feedburner:origLink></item> <item rdf:about="http://it.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1350255/personal-healthcare-info-of-over-11m-premera-customers-compromised?utm_source=rss1.0mainlinkanon&utm_medium=feed"> <title>Personal Healthcare Info of Over 11M Premera Customers Compromised</title> <link>http://rss.slashdot.org/~r/Slashdot/slashdot/~3/iAYH-Fwe9jE/personal-healthcare-info-of-over-11m-premera-customers-compromised</link> <description>An anonymous reader writes: U.S. healthcare provider Premera Blue Cross has suffered a data breach that resulted in a potential compromise of personal, financial and health-related information of as many as 11 million applicants and members. The breach was detected on January 29, 2015, and the investigation mounted by the company and by forensic investigators from Mandiant has revealed that the initial attack happened on May 5, 2014. The FBI has also been notified, and is involved in the investigation."<p><div class="share_submission" style="position:relative;"> <a class="slashpop" href="http://twitter.com/home?status=Personal+Healthcare+Info+of+Over+11M+Premera+Customers+Compromised%3A+http%3A%2F%2Fbit.ly%2F1AEYEKV"><img src="http://a.fsdn.com/sd/twitter_icon_large.png"></a> <a class="slashpop" href="http://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=http%3A%2F%2Fit.slashdot.org%2Fstory%2F15%2F03%2F18%2F1350255%2Fpersonal-healthcare-info-of-over-11m-premera-customers-compromised%3Futm_source%3Dslashdot%26utm_medium%3Dfacebook"><img src="http://a.fsdn.com/sd/facebook_icon_large.png"></a>  <a class="nobg" href="http://plus.google.com/share?url=http://it.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1350255/personal-healthcare-info-of-over-11m-premera-customers-compromised?utm_source=slashdot&amp;utm_medium=googleplus" onclick="javascript:window.open(this.href,'', 'menubar=no,toolbar=no,resizable=yes,scrollbars=yes,height=600,width=600');return false;"><img src="http://www.gstatic.com/images/icons/gplus-16.png" alt="Share on Google+"/></a>                                                                                                                                                                                  </div></p><p><a href="http://it.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1350255/personal-healthcare-info-of-over-11m-premera-customers-compromised?utm_source=rss1.0moreanon&amp;utm_medium=feed">Read more of this story</a> at Slashdot.</p><iframe src="http://slashdot.org/slashdot-it.pl?op=discuss&amp;id=7120093&amp;smallembed=1" style="height: 300px; width: 100%; border: none;"></iframe><img src="//feeds.feedburner.com/~r/Slashdot/slashdot/~4/iAYH-Fwe9jE" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description> <dc:creator>Soulskill</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-03-18T15:03:00+00:00</dc:date> <dc:subject>security</dc:subject> <slash:department>another-day,-another-breach</slash:department> <slash:section>it</slash:section> <slash:comments>61</slash:comments> <slash:hit_parade>61,61,44,34,7,3,0</slash:hit_parade> <feedburner:origLink>http://it.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1350255/personal-healthcare-info-of-over-11m-premera-customers-compromised?utm_source=rss1.0mainlinkanon&utm_medium=feed</feedburner:origLink></item> <item rdf:about="http://yro.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1311240/evolution-markets-admins-are-gone-along-with-12m-in-bitcoin?utm_source=rss1.0mainlinkanon&utm_medium=feed"> <title>Evolution Market's Admins Are Gone, Along With $12M In Bitcoin</title> <link>http://rss.slashdot.org/~r/Slashdot/slashdot/~3/hqyuIdzHP6Y/evolution-markets-admins-are-gone-along-with-12m-in-bitcoin</link> <description>tsu doh nimh writes: The Evolution Market, an online black market that sells everything contraband &mdash; from marijuana, heroin and ecstasy to stolen identities and malicious hacking services &mdash; appears to have vanished in the last 24 hours with little warning. Much to the chagrin of countless merchants hawking their wares in the underground market, the curators of the project have reportedly absconded with the community's bitcoins &mdash; a stash that some Evolution merchants reckon is worth more than USD $12 million.<p><div class="share_submission" style="position:relative;"> <a class="slashpop" href="http://twitter.com/home?status=Evolution+Market's+Admins+Are+Gone%2C+Along+With+%2412M+In+Bitcoin%3A+http%3A%2F%2Fbit.ly%2F191lTax"><img src="http://a.fsdn.com/sd/twitter_icon_large.png"></a> <a class="slashpop" href="http://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=http%3A%2F%2Fyro.slashdot.org%2Fstory%2F15%2F03%2F18%2F1311240%2Fevolution-markets-admins-are-gone-along-with-12m-in-bitcoin%3Futm_source%3Dslashdot%26utm_medium%3Dfacebook"><img src="http://a.fsdn.com/sd/facebook_icon_large.png"></a>  <a class="nobg" href="http://plus.google.com/share?url=http://yro.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1311240/evolution-markets-admins-are-gone-along-with-12m-in-bitcoin?utm_source=slashdot&amp;utm_medium=googleplus" onclick="javascript:window.open(this.href,'', 'menubar=no,toolbar=no,resizable=yes,scrollbars=yes,height=600,width=600');return false;"><img src="http://www.gstatic.com/images/icons/gplus-16.png" alt="Share on Google+"/></a>                                                                                                                                                                                  </div></p><p><a href="http://yro.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1311240/evolution-markets-admins-are-gone-along-with-12m-in-bitcoin?utm_source=rss1.0moreanon&amp;utm_medium=feed">Read more of this story</a> at Slashdot.</p><iframe src="http://slashdot.org/slashdot-it.pl?op=discuss&amp;id=7119945&amp;smallembed=1" style="height: 300px; width: 100%; border: none;"></iframe><img src="//feeds.feedburner.com/~r/Slashdot/slashdot/~4/hqyuIdzHP6Y" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description> <dc:creator>Soulskill</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-03-18T14:19:00+00:00</dc:date> <dc:subject>bitcoin</dc:subject> <slash:department>digital-golden-parachute</slash:department> <slash:section>yro</slash:section> <slash:comments>200</slash:comments> <slash:hit_parade>200,185,131,108,42,25,16</slash:hit_parade> <feedburner:origLink>http://yro.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1311240/evolution-markets-admins-are-gone-along-with-12m-in-bitcoin?utm_source=rss1.0mainlinkanon&utm_medium=feed</feedburner:origLink></item> <item rdf:about="http://yro.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1230234/microsoft-offers-pirates-amnesty-and-free-windows-10-upgrades?utm_source=rss1.0mainlinkanon&utm_medium=feed"> <title>Microsoft Offers Pirates Amnesty and Free Windows 10 Upgrades</title> <link>http://rss.slashdot.org/~r/Slashdot/slashdot/~3/usvx1S2Xhf0/microsoft-offers-pirates-amnesty-and-free-windows-10-upgrades</link> <description>An anonymous reader writes: Microsoft will make Windows 10 available as a free upgrade even to pirated copies of other Windows operating systems in China. Terry Myerson of Microsoft's operating systems unit made the announcement at the WinHEC technology conference in Shenzhen, China, and then told Reuters, "We are upgrading all qualified PCs, genuine and non-genuine, to Windows 10." Microsoft has a history of attempting to tackle massive and rising software piracy rates in Asia and developing countries, and periodically offers low-cost "licence amnesties" to the worst-offending countries, such as Indonesia and Kenya. Update: 03/18 14:59 GMT by S : Microsoft has clarified that the free upgrade will be offered for unlicensed copies of Windows worldwide, not just in China.<p><div class="share_submission" style="position:relative;"> <a class="slashpop" href="http://twitter.com/home?status=Microsoft+Offers+Pirates+Amnesty+and+Free+Windows+10+Upgrades%3A+http%3A%2F%2Fbit.ly%2F1FBwFB2"><img src="http://a.fsdn.com/sd/twitter_icon_large.png"></a> <a class="slashpop" href="http://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=http%3A%2F%2Fyro.slashdot.org%2Fstory%2F15%2F03%2F18%2F1230234%2Fmicrosoft-offers-pirates-amnesty-and-free-windows-10-upgrades%3Futm_source%3Dslashdot%26utm_medium%3Dfacebook"><img src="http://a.fsdn.com/sd/facebook_icon_large.png"></a>  <a class="nobg" href="http://plus.google.com/share?url=http://yro.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1230234/microsoft-offers-pirates-amnesty-and-free-windows-10-upgrades?utm_source=slashdot&amp;utm_medium=googleplus" onclick="javascript:window.open(this.href,'', 'menubar=no,toolbar=no,resizable=yes,scrollbars=yes,height=600,width=600');return false;"><img src="http://www.gstatic.com/images/icons/gplus-16.png" alt="Share on Google+"/></a>                                                                                                                                                                                  </div></p><p><a href="http://yro.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1230234/microsoft-offers-pirates-amnesty-and-free-windows-10-upgrades?utm_source=rss1.0moreanon&amp;utm_medium=feed">Read more of this story</a> at Slashdot.</p><iframe src="http://slashdot.org/slashdot-it.pl?op=discuss&amp;id=7119729&amp;smallembed=1" style="height: 300px; width: 100%; border: none;"></iframe><img src="//feeds.feedburner.com/~r/Slashdot/slashdot/~4/usvx1S2Xhf0" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description> <dc:creator>Soulskill</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-03-18T13:37:00+00:00</dc:date> <dc:subject>piracy</dc:subject> <slash:department>fighting-fire-with-free-gasoline</slash:department> <slash:section>yro</slash:section> <slash:comments>232</slash:comments> <slash:hit_parade>232,231,154,127,29,18,11</slash:hit_parade> <feedburner:origLink>http://yro.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1230234/microsoft-offers-pirates-amnesty-and-free-windows-10-upgrades?utm_source=rss1.0mainlinkanon&utm_medium=feed</feedburner:origLink></item> <item rdf:about="http://linux.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1217244/not-quite-dead-sco-linux-suit-against-ibm-stirs-in-utah?utm_source=rss1.0mainlinkanon&utm_medium=feed"> <title>Not Quite Dead: SCO Linux Suit Against IBM Stirs In Utah</title> <link>http://rss.slashdot.org/~r/Slashdot/slashdot/~3/Onba4iPzrTY/not-quite-dead-sco-linux-suit-against-ibm-stirs-in-utah</link> <description>An anonymous reader points to a story in the Salt Lake Tribune which says that  The nearly defunct Utah company SCO Group Inc. and IBM filed a joint report to the U.S. District Court in Salt Lake City saying that legal issues remain in the case, which was initiated in 2003 with SCO claiming damages of $5 billion against the technology giant, based in Armonk, N.Y.  That likely means that U.S. District Judge David Nuffer, who now presides over the dispute, will start moving the lawsuit &mdash; largely dormant for about four years while a related suit against Novell Inc. was adjudicated &mdash; ahead. What kind of issues? In addition to its claims of IBM misappropriation of code, SCO alleges that IBM executives and lawyers directed the company's Linux programmers to destroy source code on their computers after SCO made its allegations.  The company's other remaining claims are that IBM's actions amounted to unfair competition and interference with its contracts and business relations with other companies.  IBM has remaining claims against SCO that allege the Utah company violated contracts, copied and distributed IBM code that had been placed in Linux and that SCO created a campaign of "fear, uncertainty and doubt" about IBM's products and services because of the dispute over Unix code.<p><div class="share_submission" style="position:relative;"> <a class="slashpop" href="http://twitter.com/home?status=Not+Quite+Dead%3A+SCO+Linux+Suit+Against+IBM+Stirs+In+Utah%3A+http%3A%2F%2Fbit.ly%2F1AEwqQp"><img src="http://a.fsdn.com/sd/twitter_icon_large.png"></a> <a class="slashpop" href="http://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=http%3A%2F%2Flinux.slashdot.org%2Fstory%2F15%2F03%2F18%2F1217244%2Fnot-quite-dead-sco-linux-suit-against-ibm-stirs-in-utah%3Futm_source%3Dslashdot%26utm_medium%3Dfacebook"><img src="http://a.fsdn.com/sd/facebook_icon_large.png"></a>  <a class="nobg" href="http://plus.google.com/share?url=http://linux.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1217244/not-quite-dead-sco-linux-suit-against-ibm-stirs-in-utah?utm_source=slashdot&amp;utm_medium=googleplus" onclick="javascript:window.open(this.href,'', 'menubar=no,toolbar=no,resizable=yes,scrollbars=yes,height=600,width=600');return false;"><img src="http://www.gstatic.com/images/icons/gplus-16.png" alt="Share on Google+"/></a>                                                                                                                                                                                  </div></p><p><a href="http://linux.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1217244/not-quite-dead-sco-linux-suit-against-ibm-stirs-in-utah?utm_source=rss1.0moreanon&amp;utm_medium=feed">Read more of this story</a> at Slashdot.</p><iframe src="http://slashdot.org/slashdot-it.pl?op=discuss&amp;id=7119681&amp;smallembed=1" style="height: 300px; width: 100%; border: none;"></iframe><img src="//feeds.feedburner.com/~r/Slashdot/slashdot/~4/Onba4iPzrTY" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description> <dc:creator>timothy</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-03-18T12:54:00+00:00</dc:date> <dc:subject>caldera</dc:subject> <slash:department>no-one-expects-the-mcbride-inquisition</slash:department> <slash:section>linux</slash:section> <slash:comments>142</slash:comments> <slash:hit_parade>142,138,104,90,39,24,16</slash:hit_parade> <feedburner:origLink>http://linux.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/1217244/not-quite-dead-sco-linux-suit-against-ibm-stirs-in-utah?utm_source=rss1.0mainlinkanon&utm_medium=feed</feedburner:origLink></item> <item rdf:about="http://tech.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/0222225/nvidia-to-install-computers-in-cars-to-teach-them-how-to-drive?utm_source=rss1.0mainlinkanon&utm_medium=feed"> <title>NVIDIA To Install Computers In Cars To Teach Them How To Drive</title> <link>http://rss.slashdot.org/~r/Slashdot/slashdot/~3/qhVP9u_fNzw/nvidia-to-install-computers-in-cars-to-teach-them-how-to-drive</link> <description>jfruh writes: NVIDIA has unveiled the Drive PX, a $10,000 computer that will be installed in cars and gather data about how to react to driving obstacles. "Driving is not about detecting, driving is a learned behavior," said Jen Hsun Huang, CEO of NVIDIA. The data collected by Drive PXes will be shared, allowing cars to learn the right and wrong reactions to different situations, essentially figuring out what to do from experience rather than a rigid set of pre-defined situations.<p><div class="share_submission" style="position:relative;"> <a class="slashpop" href="http://twitter.com/home?status=NVIDIA+To+Install+Computers+In+Cars+To+Teach+Them+How+To+Drive%3A+http%3A%2F%2Fbit.ly%2F1BTBvZa"><img src="http://a.fsdn.com/sd/twitter_icon_large.png"></a> <a class="slashpop" href="http://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=http%3A%2F%2Ftech.slashdot.org%2Fstory%2F15%2F03%2F18%2F0222225%2Fnvidia-to-install-computers-in-cars-to-teach-them-how-to-drive%3Futm_source%3Dslashdot%26utm_medium%3Dfacebook"><img src="http://a.fsdn.com/sd/facebook_icon_large.png"></a>  <a class="nobg" href="http://plus.google.com/share?url=http://tech.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/0222225/nvidia-to-install-computers-in-cars-to-teach-them-how-to-drive?utm_source=slashdot&amp;utm_medium=googleplus" onclick="javascript:window.open(this.href,'', 'menubar=no,toolbar=no,resizable=yes,scrollbars=yes,height=600,width=600');return false;"><img src="http://www.gstatic.com/images/icons/gplus-16.png" alt="Share on Google+"/></a>                                                                                                                                                                                  </div></p><p><a href="http://tech.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/0222225/nvidia-to-install-computers-in-cars-to-teach-them-how-to-drive?utm_source=rss1.0moreanon&amp;utm_medium=feed">Read more of this story</a> at Slashdot.</p><iframe src="http://slashdot.org/slashdot-it.pl?op=discuss&amp;id=7116361&amp;smallembed=1" style="height: 300px; width: 100%; border: none;"></iframe><img src="//feeds.feedburner.com/~r/Slashdot/slashdot/~4/qhVP9u_fNzw" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description> <dc:creator>Soulskill</dc:creator> <dc:date>2015-03-18T12:12:00+00:00</dc:date> <dc:subject>ai</dc:subject> <slash:department>learn-by-doing</slash:department> <slash:section>technology</slash:section> <slash:comments>72</slash:comments> <slash:hit_parade>72,72,50,43,11,6,2</slash:hit_parade> <feedburner:origLink>http://tech.slashdot.org/story/15/03/18/0222225/nvidia-to-install-computers-in-cars-to-teach-them-how-to-drive?utm_source=rss1.0mainlinkanon&utm_medium=feed</feedburner:origLink></item> <textinput rdf:about="http://slashdot.org/search.pl"> <title>Search Slashdot</title> <description>Search Slashdot stories</description> <name>query</name> <link>http://slashdot.org/search.pl</link> </textinput> </rdf:RDF>
